message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS 

This paper is about optimizing recommendation models, which falls under the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. The paper proposes a new sampler design for Bayesian Personalized Ranking (BPR), which is a machine learning method, and thus it could also be categorized under the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Additionally, the paper leverages additional view data to improve the sampler, which involves modeling user preferences, and thus it could also be categorized under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper also involves learning pairwise rankings and weighting strategies, which could fall under the social and information networks (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves real-world datasets, which could also fall under the data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
